member.summary: Gets or sets the client authentication options to use when establishing a new connection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the optional local endpoint that will be bound to.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicClientConnectionOptions.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote endpoint to connect to. May be a , which will get resolved to an IP before connecting, or an .

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection
member.summary: Represents a QUIC connection, which doesn't send or receive data itself but rather allows opening or accepting multiple streams.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.AcceptInboundStreamAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Accepts an inbound .
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that completes with the accepted .

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.CloseAsync(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Closes the connection with the application provided-code.
member.param: An application-provided code with the reason for closure.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that completes when the connection is closed.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.ConnectAsync(System.Net.Quic.QuicClientConnectionOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a new and connects it to the peer.
member.param: Options for the connection.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that completes with the connected connection.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.DisposeAsync
member.summary: If not closed explicitly by , closes the connection silently (leading to idle timeout on the peer side) and releases all resources associated with the connection.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.OpenOutboundStreamAsync(System.Net.Quic.QuicStreamType,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates an outbound unidirectional or bidirectional .
member.param: The type of the stream, either unidirectional or bidirectional.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that completes with the opened .

member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether QUIC is supported on the current machine.
member.returns: if QUIC is supported on the current machine and can be used; otherwise, .

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local endpoint used for this connection.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.NegotiatedApplicationProtocol
member.summary: Gets the final, negotiated application protocol.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.RemoteCertificate
member.summary: Gets the certificate provided by the peer.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnection.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote endpoint used for this connection.

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnectionOptions
member.summary: Shared options for both client (outbound) and server (inbound) Quic connections.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnectionOptions.DefaultCloseErrorCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the error code used for when the connection is disposed.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnectionOptions.DefaultStreamErrorCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the error code used when the stream needs to abort the read or write side of the stream internally.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnectionOptions.IdleTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the idle timeout for connections. The idle timeout is the time after which the connection will be closed. Default means underlying implementation default idle timeout.
member.returns: The idle timeout for connections. The default is , which means that the default idle timeout of the underlying implementation is used.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnectionOptions.MaxInboundBidirectionalStreams
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent bidirectional streams that the remote peer connection can create on an open connection.
member.returns: The limit on the number of bidirectional streams the remote peer connection can create on an open connection. The default is 0 for client connections and 100 for server connections.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicConnectionOptions.MaxInboundUnidirectionalStreams
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent unidirectional streams that the remote peer connection can create on an open connection.
member.returns: The limit on the number of unidirectional streams the remote peer connection can create on an open connection. The default is 0 for client connections and 10 for server connections.

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicError
member.summary: Defines the various error conditions for , , and operations.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.AddressInUse
member.summary: The local address is already in use.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.ConnectionAborted
member.summary: The connection was aborted by the peer. This error is associated with an application-level error code.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.ConnectionIdle
member.summary: The connection timed out from inactivity.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.ConnectionRefused
member.summary: The server refused the connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The connection timed out waiting for a response from the peer.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.HostUnreachable
member.summary: The server is currently unreachable.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.InternalError
member.summary: An internal implementation error occurred.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.InvalidAddress
member.summary: Failed to bind to the socket, likely caused by a family mismatch between the local and remote address.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.OperationAborted
member.summary: The operation has been aborted.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.ProtocolError
member.summary: A QUIC protocol error occurred.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.StreamAborted
member.summary: The read or write direction of the stream was aborted by the peer. This error is associated with an application-level error code.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.Success
member.summary: No error.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicError.VersionNegotiationError
member.summary: A version negotiation error occurred.

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a QUIC error occurs.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The error associated with the exception.
The application protocol error code associated with the error.
The message for the exception.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicException.ApplicationErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the application protocol error code associated with the error.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicException.QuicError
member.summary: Gets the error that's associated with this exception.

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicListener
member.summary: Represents a listener that listens for incoming QUIC connections. can accept multiple Quic connections.

member.summary: Accepts an inbound .
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task that contains a fully connected that successfully finished the handshake and is ready to be used.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicListener.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Stops listening for new connections and releases all resources associated with the listener.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.

A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that completes with the started listener.

member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether QUIC is supported on the current machine.
member.returns: if QUIC is supported on the current machine and can be used; otherwise, .

member.summary: Gets the actual listening endpoint.

member.summary: Options to provide to a .

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicListenerOptions.ApplicationProtocols
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of application protocols that the listener will accept. At least one must be specified.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicListenerOptions.ConnectionOptionsCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection callback to choose inbound connection options dynamically.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicListenerOptions.ListenBacklog
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of connections to be held without accepting any of them, that is, the maximum size of the pending connection queue.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicListenerOptions.ListenEndPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the endpoint to listen on.

member.summary: Options for server (inbound) Quic connections. These options are provided by .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the server authentication options to use when accepting a new connection.

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream
member.summary: Represents a QUIC stream. can be unidirectional, that is, write-only for the opening side, or bidirectional, which allows both sides to write.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Abort(System.Net.Quic.QuicAbortDirection,System.Int64)
member.summary: Aborts either the reading, writing, or both sides of the stream.
member.param: The direction of the stream to abort.
The error code with which to abort the stream. This value is application-protocol (which is the layer above QUIC) dependent.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation. (Consider using instead.)
member.param: The buffer to read the data into.
The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data read from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the read is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous read, which could still be pending.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.BeginWrite(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write operation. (Consider using instead.)
member.param: The buffer to write data from.
The byte offset in buffer from which to begin writing.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the write is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous write request from other requests.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous write, which could still be pending.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.CompleteWrites
member.summary: Gracefully completes the writing side of the stream.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.DisposeAsync
member.summary: If the read side is not fully consumed, that is, is not completed or hasn't returned 0, aborts the read side with provided . If the write side hasn't been closed, closes it gracefully as if was called. Finally, all resources associated with the stream will be released.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.EndRead(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous read to complete. (Consider using instead.)
member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request to finish.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the stream, between zero (0) and the number of bytes you requested. Streams return zero (0) only at the end of the stream, otherwise, they should block until at least one byte is available.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous write operation. (Consider using instead.)
member.param: A reference to the outstanding asynchronous I/O request.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.FlushAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously clears all buffers for this stream, causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous flush operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Read(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: A region of memory. When this method returns, the contents of this region are replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes allocated in the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.ReadAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The buffer to write the data into.
The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation. The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.ReadAsync(System.Memory{System.Byte},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The region of memory to write the data into.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation. The value of its property contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the number of bytes allocated in the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an , or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the current position of the stream to the given value. This method is not currently supported and always throws a .
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the stream. This method is not currently supported and always throws a .
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Write(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: A region of memory. This method copies the contents of this region to the current stream.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.WriteAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The buffer to write data from.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.WriteAsync(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte},System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The region of memory to write data from.
true to notify the peer about gracefully closing the write side, that is, to send the FIN flag with the data; otherwise, false.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.WriteAsync(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The region of memory to write data from.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

member.name: M:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the supports reading.
member.returns: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the supports seeking.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.CanTimeout
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the can timeout.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the supports writing.
member.returns: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Id
member.summary: Gets the stream ID.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the data available on the stream. This property is not currently supported and always throws a .
member.returns: A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position within the current stream. This property is not currently supported and always throws a .
member.returns: The current position within the stream.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.ReadsClosed
member.summary: Gets a that will complete once the reading side has been closed.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.ReadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, that determines how long the stream will attempt to read before timing out.
member.returns: A value, in milliseconds, that determines how long the stream will attempt to read before timing out.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.Type
member.summary: Gets the stream type.

member.name: P:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.WritesClosed
member.summary: Gets a that will complete when the writing side has been closed.

member.name: T:System.Net.Quic.QuicStreamType
member.summary: Represents the type of a stream.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicStreamType.Bidirectional
member.summary: Both peers are read and write capable.

member.name: F:System.Net.Quic.QuicStreamType.Unidirectional
member.summary: Write-only for the peer that opened the stream. Read-only for the peer that accepted the stream.
